text: Megapiranha is an extinct serrasalmid fish described in 2009. The name is a combination of the word "mega" and piranha. This freshwater fish is called megapiranha, giant serrasalmid, or cutting fish by people in other countries. == Description == Megapiranha was a giant piranha having the teeth of a modern serrasalmid. Megapiranhas can bite you if you see them in real life. Megapiranha has one species called Megapiranha paranensis. == Related pages == * Prehistoric fish * Prehistoric eel * Urosphen, a relative from Argentina Category:Animals of South America Category:Characiformes Category:Extinct fish Category:Freshwater fish
title: Megapiranha
